item.title: Jessica add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "So that's who Finnick loves, I think. Not his string of fancy lovers in the Capitol. But a poor, mad girl back home. " -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Susanna Clarke
item.description: "There is nothing in the world so easy to explain as failure - it is, after all, what everybody does all the time." -- Susanna Clarke

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Susanna Clarke
Jessica add a quote by Susanna Clarke
item.description: "He gave her his heart. She took it and placed it quietly in the pocket of her gown. No one observed what she did." -- Susanna Clarke

item.title: Jessica add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "Do not be deceived, Wormwood. Our cause is never more in danger than when a human, no longer desiring, but still intending, to do our Enemy's will, looks round upon a universe from which every trace of Him seems to have vanished, and asks why he has been forsaken, and still obeys." -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Philip Carr-Gomm
item.description: "Ultimately, the purpose of magic is to free our potential, not bind us to ideas." -- Philip Carr-Gomm

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Susanna Clarke
item.description:
"Not long, not long my father said Not long shall you be ours The Raven King knows all too well Which are the fairest flowers.
The priest was all too worldly Though he prayed and rang his bell The Raven King three candles lit The priest said it was well
Her arms were all too feeble Though she claimed to love me so The Raven King stretched out his hand She sighed and let me go
The land is all too shallow It is painted on the sky And trembles like the wind-shook rain When the Raven King goes by
For always and for always I pray remember me Upon the moors, beneath the stars With the Kingâ€™s wild company." -- Susanna Clarke

item.title: Jessica add a quote by Philip Carr-Gomm
item.description: "The risks involved in the pursuit of magic are--put simply--either getting frightened by unpleasant perceptions or becoming deluded. Unfortunately it is possible to suffer from both symptoms at the same time." -- Philip Carr-Gomm
